definition: to ascertain/to act on/to criticize/to pass on/classifier for batches, lots, military flights/tier (for the ranking of universities and colleges)
to discuss/to comment/to criticize/to judge/to choose (by public appraisal)

home/family/(polite) my (sister, uncle etc)/classifier for families or businesses/refers to the philosophical schools of pre-Han China/noun suffix for a specialist in some activity, such as a musician or revolutionary, corresponding to English -ist, -er, -ary or -ian/CL:個|个[ge4]

sentences.english: A critic is a legless man who teaches running.
sentences.chinese: 批評家，是教人跑步的無腿的人。

sentences.english: Come writers and critics. Who prophesize with your pen.
sentences.chinese: 來吧，預言以筆的作家，批評家們。

sentences.english: The critics have denigrated our efforts.
sentences.chinese: 批評家們受到有力的反駁。

sentences.english: Other art critics have suggested that Kemp has succumbed to a fantasy.
sentences.chinese: 其他藝術批評家也認爲坎普屈從於幻想。

sentences.english: The green budget measure turns the pressure back on his critics.
sentences.chinese: 這些綠色預算措施將壓力施加給陸先生的批評家們。

sentences.english: But critics point out that there are risks inherent in nanotechnology.
sentences.chinese: 但是，有批評家指出納米技術存在固有風險。

sentences.english: But I have been surprised at what some critics have said about Torres' involvement.
sentences.chinese: 然而，我驚訝於某些批評家對有關託雷斯事件的批評。

sentences.english: The novelist lapped up great praise from critics.
sentences.chinese: 小說家欣然接受了批評家們的高度讚揚。

sentences.english: A good critic is one who narrates the adventures of his mind among masterpieces.
sentences.chinese: 好的批評家是個講述自己的精神在傑作中歷險的人。

sentences.english: Chapter five examines the late Qing critics as a group and studies the most important ones.
sentences.chinese: 第五章以晚清批評家爲羣體擇其要者研究之。

sentences.english: He is a truly perceptive critic.
sentences.chinese: 他確是一位很有眼力的批評家。

sentences.english: Critics say the mass weddings prove the church brainwashes its followers.
sentences.chinese: 批評家說集體婚禮證明了教堂對它的信徒進行洗腦。

sentences.english: Come writers and critics. Who prophesize with your pen.
sentences.chinese: 來吧，作家和批評家，那些善於玩弄你筆頭的人們。

sentences.english: The writer was still naïve about critical power.
sentences.chinese: 這位作家尚不知批評家的厲害。

sentences.english: Critics of religion might say that this just shows the manifest irrationality of religion.
sentences.chinese: 宗教批評家們可能說，這恰恰說明了信徒們的非理性。

definition: Mishima Yukio (1925-1970), Japanese author, pen name of (平岡公威|平冈公威, Hiraoka Kimitake)
Yantai prefecture level city in Shandong
to write for sb else/a lawyer who writes legal documents for his clients
to communicate by means of written notes (instead of speaking)/to publish one's opinion (e.g. as part of a scholarly dialogue)/(in book titles) essays/sketches
